title: Phrack XX Index
historical_context: This issue marks the return of key figures in the Phrack community after a hiatus, reflecting a transitional period in hacker culture.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, security professionals, and enthusiasts of hacker culture history.
short_summary: The Phrack XX Index serves as an introduction to the issue, detailing the return of its original editors and the contents dedicated to the Metal Shop Private community.
summary: This issue is not just a collection of articles but a homage to the vibrant discussions that characterized Metal Shop Private. It includes various sections such as gossip, social engineering, and discussions relevant to new users, showcasing the diverse interests within the hacker community. The editors hint at future developments, promising more content in the upcoming Phrack XXI, thus maintaining the anticipation and engagement of their audience. The Phrack XX Index is a significant piece for anyone interested in the evolution of hacker culture and the dynamics of online communities during this era.
